trustfund:
TF052611-GEF3 PDFB-MALAWI:PREPARATION OF
            THE INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICES PROJECT,TF052632-GEF3 PDFB-MALAWI:PREPARATION OF
            INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICES PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Infrastructure Service
            Project for Malawi were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and borrower
            performance also moderately satisfactory. Some of the
            lessons learned included: readiness for implementation at
            approval is critical for achievement of planned
            implementation schedules. Institutional arrangements are
            particularly important for successful project design and
            implementation. Implementation of multi sectorial projects
            requires strong and effective coordination by government at
            a range of levels. The bank's performance during
            preparation and implementation is critically important
            towards achievement of development outcomes, particularly
            for projects set in weaker institutional environments and
            for multi-sectorial works. Timely and thorough mid-term
            reviews and restructuring are important to the achievement
            of development outcomes and performance ratings. Well
            defined internal bank systems are required for effective
            support to multi-sectorial projects. And further analytical
            work will strengthen and support the contextual
            appropriateness and benefits associated with the
            multi-sectorial approach and role of local governments in
            the delivery of services.
